bd.com.ipay.sdk

Class IPaySDK

  • java.lang.Object
    • bd.com.ipay.sdk.IPaySDK

  • public final class IPaySDK
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is designed to initialize and customize the uses of iPay SDK.
    Since:
    1.0.0-SNAPSHOT

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(android.content.Context applicationContext)
        As iPay SDK initializes automatically(This function is called automatically on app start up), there is no necessity to call this method. Although this method can be called manually if needed. This method mainly verifies few cases to check if the user mobile environment is suitable enough to perform iPay checkout.
        Parameters:
        applicationContext - The application context

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(android.content.Context applicationContext,
                              IPaySDK.InitializeCallback initializeCallback)
        As iPay SDK initializes automatically(This function is called automatically on app start up), there is no necessity to call this method. Although this method can be called manually if needed. This method mainly verifies few cases to check if the user mobile environment is suitable enough to perform iPay checkout.
        Parameters:
        applicationContext - The application context
        initializeCallback - An initialize callback to get the status of the initialization.

      • performCheckout

        public static IPaySDK.CheckoutState performCheckout(android.app.Activity activity,
                                                    java.lang.String checkoutUrl)
        If the device have iPay app installed, for a valid checkout url, this method will perform a checkout through iPay app. In case of iPay isn't present it will open Play Store to install the iPay app.
        Parameters:
        activity - An android Activity
        checkoutUrl - iPay checkout url
        Returns:

      • performCheckout

        public static IPaySDK.CheckoutState performCheckout(android.app.Activity activity,
                                                    java.lang.String checkoutUrl,
                                                    boolean shouldThrow)
        If the device have iPay app installed, for a valid checkout url, this method will perform a checkout through iPay app. In case of iPay isn't present it can to do two things depending on the param shouldThrow value. If the value is true then it will throw an IPaySDKException exception. Otherwise it will open Play Store to install the iPay app.
        Parameters:
        activity - An android Activity
        checkoutUrl - iPay checkout url
        shouldThrow - should the method throw an exception for error or not
        Throws:
        IPaySDKException - if the param shouldThrow is true then this method will throw IPaySDKException if IPay app isn't installed on device.

      • performCheckout

        public static IPaySDK.CheckoutState performCheckout(android.app.Activity activity,
                                                    java.lang.String checkoutUrl,
                                                    boolean shouldThrow,
                                                    boolean useCallbackActivity)
        If the device have iPay app installed, for a valid checkout url, this method will perform a checkout through iPay app. In case of iPay isn't present it can to do two things depending on the param shouldThrow value. If the value is true then it will throw an IPaySDKException exception. Otherwise it will open Play Store to install the iPay app. When the param useCallbackActivity is true, after completing a checkout. IPaySDK will send necessary data to the provided callback activity not to the activity from it was called.
        Parameters:
        activity - An android Activity
        checkoutUrl - iPay checkout url
        shouldThrow - Should the method throw an exception for error or not
        useCallbackActivity - Should the method send the data to another activity for completing the checkout or not
        Returns:
        the state of the checkout.
        Throws:
        IPaySDKException - if the param shouldThrow is true then this method will throw IPaySDKException if IPay app isn't installed on device.

      • performCheckoutWithFallback

        public static IPaySDK.CheckoutState performCheckoutWithFallback(android.app.Activity activity,
                                                                java.lang.String checkoutUrl,
                                                                CheckoutCallbackActionUrls checkoutCallbackActionUrls)
        For a valid checkout url, this method will perform a checkout through iPay app. In case of iPay isn't present it will checkout via WebView. IPaySDK will send necessary data to the calling activity.
        Parameters:
        activity - An android Activity
        checkoutUrl - iPay checkout url
        checkoutCallbackActionUrls - all three callback urls which was give to iPay during the creation of the checkout
        Returns:
        the state of the checkout.

      • performCheckoutWithFallback

        public static IPaySDK.CheckoutState performCheckoutWithFallback(android.app.Activity activity,
                                                                java.lang.String checkoutUrl,
                                                                boolean useCallbackActivity,
                                                                CheckoutCallbackActionUrls checkoutCallbackActionUrls)
        For a valid checkout url, this method will perform a checkout through iPay app. In case of iPay isn't present it will checkout via WebView. When the param useCallbackActivity is true, after completing a checkout. IPaySDK will send necessary data to the provided callback activity not to the activity from it was called.
        Parameters:
        activity - An android Activity
        checkoutUrl - iPay checkout url
        useCallbackActivity - Should the method send the data to another activity for completing the checkout or not
        checkoutCallbackActionUrls - all three callback urls which was give to iPay during the creation of the checkout
        Returns:
        the state of the checkout.

      • isInitialized

        public static boolean isInitialized()
        Indicates whether the iPay SDK has been initialized.
        Returns:
        true if initialized, false if not

      • isDebugLogEnabled

        public static boolean isDebugLogEnabled()
        Returns:
        boolean value of debug log enabled or not.

      • setDebugLogEnabled

        public static void setDebugLogEnabled(boolean debugLogEnabled)
        Sets value to identify whether the SDK should Log SDK events.
        Parameters:
        debugLogEnabled - indicates boolean value, whether the log should be printed or not.

      • getCheckoutRequestCode

        public static int getCheckoutRequestCode()
        Returns:
        value of request code which used to start activity result of IPayCheckoutActivity.

      • setCheckoutRequestCode

        public static void setCheckoutRequestCode(int requestCode)
        Sets request code for starting checkout activity.
        Parameters:
        requestCode - Value for request code.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the param value is less than 0.

      • getCheckoutCallBackActivity

        public static java.lang.String getCheckoutCallBackActivity()
        Returns:
        Name of checkout callback activity name.

      • setCheckoutCallBackActivity

        public static void setCheckoutCallBackActivity(android.content.Context context,
                                               java.lang.String checkoutCallBackActivity)
        Parameters:
        context - An android context
        checkoutCallBackActivity - Callback activity canonical name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the activity does not exists or not declared in AndroidManifest.xml. For more info see PackageManager.getActivityInfo(ComponentName, int)
